message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.EM, cs.CV 

The paper discusses the use of neuromorphic circuits for efficient hardware representations of neural networks, which falls under the category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE). The focus on synaptic weight elements based on Non-Volatile Memories (NVMs) suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of Emerging Technologies (cs.ET). The use of Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) architectures and the demonstration on image classification datasets such as MNIST and EMNIST suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) and Applied Robotics (cs.AR). Finally, the discussion of non-idealities in hardware and the proposed off-line, continuously differentiable HW-aware training algorithm suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of Embedded Systems (cs.EM).
